intro: Blitum nuttallianum, commonly known as Nuttall's blitum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its range.
